hintAnswer: G(r) input=distance and G(r) output=force. a(F) input=force and a(F) output=accelaration.
title: Define Input and Output
text: Define the input and output for each function.

title: Composition of Functions
text: We see that G(r) has the same output as the input of a(F) (force). So, a(G(r)) is meaningful.

title: Interpretation
text: So, reading a(G(r)) from left to $$right, a(G(r))=acceleration$$ of the gravitational force for a planet from a distance $$r$$ from the sun.
